channel.title: Powershell on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Powershell on TLDRBins

item.title: Runas
item.description: RunasCS .\RunasCs.exe '<USER>' '<PASSWORD>' "<CMD>" -l <LOGON_TYPE> # Or .\RunasCs.exe '<USER>' '<PASSWORD>' --bypass-uac "<CMD>" -l <LOGON_TYPE> 2 Interactive 3 Network 4 Batch 5 Service 7 Unlock 8 NetworkCleartext 9 NewCredentials 10 RemoteInteractive 11 CachedInteractive Create credential object Method #1 Method #2 $username = '<DOMAIN>\<USER>' $password = ConvertTo-SecureString '<PASSWORD>' -AsPlainText -Force $cred = New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential($username, $password) $username = '<DOMAIN>\<USER>' $password = '<PASSWORD>' $secstr = New-Object -TypeName System.Security.SecureString $password.ToCharArray() | ForEach-Object {$secstr.AppendChar($_)} $cred = new-object -typename System.

item.title: Secure String
item.description: Decrypt secure string Windows $s = cat pass.xml PS C:\programdata> $s = "01000000d0 ---[SNIP]--- e63b3f24ec" $ss = Convertto-securestring -string $s PS C:\programdata> $ss = Convertto-securestring -string $s $ss = Convertto-securestring -string $s # Decrypt (New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential 'N/A', $ss).GetNetworkCredential().Password PS C:\programdata> (New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential 'N/A', $ss).GetNetworkCredential().Password (New-Object System.Management.Automation.PSCredential 'N/A', $ss).GetNetworkCredential().Password AhXpFsOusi ---[SNIP]--- 0LxlUqc0Y= # Or save as cred $cred = new-object -typename System.Management.Automation.PSCredential -argumentlist "<USER>", $ss $cred.GetNetworkCredential().password
